bibl.author: William Sloane Kennedy
bibl.title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 18 February 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Yes, I have seen Havelock's bk & chap. on W.W. Yes it is very gloomy weather. I am "swain by winter pinched & worn" somewhat myself, toothache &c. Had a stunning dinner, though today (at great upstairs Quincy market restaurant) (chicken soup & rump steak & corn bread.) Yr frequent mention of oysters has led me to think of them, & we have 'em after. I stick a can full in ulster packet, & merrily home I glide. Good letter fr. mother today (in Oberlind). Well the richest blessings of time & eternity to you in a glass of orange wine (good, too). Love unlimited fr. yr constant lover & friend.
